subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_008E_01C9D9F3.F8BA2980
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You want we should whack 'im Frank??

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fro=
m: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 21,=
 2009 9:05 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's B=
ox?






   Same old crap, these self proclaimed experts have no idea what=
 they are talking about! It's not the selling of boxes that gets me, it's t=
he description of how it works--friggin' clueless! "The Box" does not gener=
ate white noise that allows spirits to create voices, the entities use the =
bits of speech, and music to form voices! You're supposed to believe these =
people are "professional investigators", yet they can't even get the simple=
st concept. When I speak up, I'm the one being mean and negative. 

   "Exp=
erts"! forget the tired old way of recording EVP, white noise is not needed=
, and is a real pain to listen to. White noise was just an early attempt to=
 provide a raw audio, in the early days, but it was piss poor at best! Forg=
et that crap, you need something that provides human speech bits, and frequ=
encies. Of course you can get direct direct recordings without noise or raw=
 audio, but---it tends to be weak noise that most of time are questionable.=
 

   So just for the record, the box functions by sweeping a radio across =
it's tuning range, the resulting bits of human specch, music and noise is r=
eferred to as raw audio, which the entities rearrange, or re-modualte to fo=
rm meaningful messages. EVPmaker provides this raw audio by chopping up pre=
-recorded SPEECH, stored as a .wav file, then playing this audio through th=
e computer speakers while recording the result at the same time. EVPmaker d=
oes not create white noise either.

   Frank-S


  On Thu, May 21, 2009 at =
8:25 AM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:




=

    Ok-found the "Report This Item" link. But there is no option for untru=
e advertising. So I guess eBay doesn't think that is a big enough offense.
=

    Someone could contact the seller and tell him then they know it isn't =
true. I don't feel qualified to do so since I only know Frank from this lis=
t, and I have only been on this list a short time.

    It may not do any g=
ood, but maybe it will.


      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: A=
pril Abercrombie 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Thursday, =
May 21, 2009 8:09 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sort=
a Frank's Box?



      Yes...I know.... but it is fun to fantasize. Plus, =
if I am in a position to make a difference I will. The problem is knowing w=
hen or where that position is.

        ----- Original Message ----- 
     =
   From: Kristin Morris 
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
        Sent:=
 Thursday, May 21, 2009 7:56 AM
        Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auc=
tion for sorta Frank's Box?



        We can=92t police the entire interne=
t.  People should take responsibility for themselves and do some research a=
nd find out how this works before they purchase.  

        Caveat emptor..=
  



---------------------------------------------------------------------=
---

        From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com]=
 On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
        Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 8:45 A=
M
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Eb=
ay auction for sorta Frank's Box?







        Exactly! That's what I'm s=
ayin'.


        Wouldn't it be a hoot if Frank himself blasted the guy. Bu=
t that isn't the mature way..... ;)


          ----- Original Message ----=
- 

          From: threadsintyme@... 

          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com 

          Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 5:52 AM

          Subject=
: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?


          Why don=
't some of us respond to his ad...and take serious issue with this business=
 of his lying to the public about Frank? 

          That info is a serious=
 breach of eBay policy. He could be banned from eBay for life. 
          A=
l
          ---------- Original Message ----------
          From: "Kristin=
 Morris" <ckmorris95@...>
          To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>=

          Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
 =
         Date: Thu, 21 May 2009 06:16:27 -0500

          WOW.. Frank.  I d=
idn=92t realize you were charging =96 and =93thousands of dollars=94 to boo=
t!  Must be to pay for that Faraday Cage and the white noise generator thin=
g this yahoo believes are in all your creations.  And hurry because =93his =
supplier=94 (cough =96 cough Radio Shack) is discontinuing!  But no worries=
 he has =93sold over 2 dozen of these =91Frank=92s Boxes devices=94 so he m=
ust be legit because he knows =96 and actual customer bought a =91real=92 F=
rank=92s Box and said it was equal!  Awesome=85

          k


------------=
----------------------------------------------------------

          From:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of ouro=
bouros2k2
          Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 12:50 AM
          To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sort=
a Frank's Box?







          Been following this unprofessional idiot's =
items for awhile now. I love how he says that Frank charges thousands of do=
llars for an original Frank's box. 

          This dude is the worst type =
of con, preying on people who know only enough to be familiar with the term=
 Frank's box. Then again, it always has bothered me when people take shack =
hacks and charge stupid prices for them on ebay under the Frank's box monik=
er.

          This guy is based out of Nevada I believe, and his group's e=
thics leave little to be desired. Takes all kinds, I reckon...

          A=
ndy

          --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote=
:
          >
          > Hmmm... saw this on Ebay tonight... you've got to=
 read all the text to hear
          > how he describes what he's selling. =

          > 
          > Do any of you on this list know who he is? I just=
 thought this was kind of
          > interesting... see:
          > 
    =
      > http://tinyurl.com/o5pper
          > 
          > Cheers,
        =
  > 
          > Leslie, consistent lurker and occasional poster <g>
      =
    > 
          > "I'm not happy, I'm cheerful. There's a difference. A ha=
ppy woman has no
          > cares at all. A cheerful woman has cares but h=
as learned how to deal with them."
          > 
          > -- Beverly Sill=
s (1929-) American Opera Singer
          >



          __________________=
__________________________________________
          Start a Web Site! Host=
ing for only $3.95/mo. Free setup!
